འཚེར་] «I» འཚོར། The reading འཚེར་ is confirmed by Sanskrit स्वच्छोज्ज्वल (svacchojjvala) and supported by KP's gloss འོད་འཕྲོ་བས་འཚེར་བ།

critical_apparatus.3: བླ་རེ་] «N,Q» བྲེ། The reading བླ་རེ་ is confirmed by Sanskrit विताना (vitāna) and supported by KP's gloss བླ་རེ་དང་འཕན་གདུགས།

མནྡཱ་ར་] I མནད་ར། The reading མནྡཱ་ར་ is confirmed by the Sanskrit मान्दारव and consistently attested in the commentaries of KS, TS (མནྡཱ་ར་), and KP (མནྡ་ར་). The variant in I appears to be a scribal error.

དབུལ་] F,G འབུལ། The reading དབུལ་ is preferred based on the Sanskrit निवेदयामि (nivēdayāmi) and supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). KP specifically uses དབུལ་ in his explanation. The Sanskrit verb form निवेद् (nivēd) in causative present tense matches better with དབུལ་ rather than འབུལ།
སྒྲོན་མེ་] C,N,Q མེ། Chosen reading སྒྲོན་མེ་ confirmed by Skt. रत्नप्रदीपान् and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which consistently interpret as རིན་ཆེན་སྒྲོན་མེ་
critical_apparatus.2: བྱ] C,N,Q བགྱི། Chosen reading བྱ supported by Skt. किरामि (present tense) and parallel construction with previous verse ending. KP,TS use དགྲམ་པར་བྱ/བགྱི showing either reading possible.

critical_apparatus.1: བརྒྱན] C; ལྡན NQ. The reading བརྒྱན is supported by Sanskrit संसक्त and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which use བརྒྱན.
critical_apparatus.2: བལྟ] C; ལྟ NQ. The reading བལྟ is preferable as it appears in this form in KP, GDR and KS, and better matches the Sanskrit कमनीय (lovely to look at).

critical_apparatus.1: སྡུག་] C,F,G,P; སྔག་ I,སྡག་ The reading སྡུག་ is confirmed by the Sanskrit सत्त्व and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which consistently give སྡུག་བསྔལ་
critical_apparatus.2: སིམ་] C; ཚིམ་ FGIP The reading སིམ་ is supported by both TS and KS who explicitly use སིམ་, while KP uses སིམ་པའི་དགར་. critical_apparatus.1: ཤོག །] I,P ཤོག། །. The single shad reading is preferred based on Sanskrit verse ending ॥२१॥ and standard Classical Tibetan punctuation conventions for verse endings.

ཀུན་དུ་] C,F,G ཀུན་ཏུ། The reading དུ is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit स्व- and is supported by commentaries KP and GDR who interpret it as དུས་དང་རྣམ་པ་ཀུན་དུ and ཡུལ་དུས་ཀུན་ཏུ respectively. While ཏུ appears in some witnesses, དུ better reflects the temporal-spatial totality implied by the Sanskrit अनन्यथा.

བཏུད་པ་ཡིས་] C,N,Q པས་ནི་ | The reading པ་ཡིས་ is preferred as it better corresponds to the Sanskrit instrumental प्रणामैः. This is supported by KP's gloss using གུས་པས་. Additionally, the particle ཡིས་ maintains the verse's metrical structure more elegantly than ནི་.

རྣམས་ལ་] N,Q ཀུན་ལའང་། The reading རྣམས་ལ་ is supported by the Sanskrit सर्वचैत्यानि and also by KP's commentary which uses རྣམས་ལ་. The variant ཀུན་ལའང་ appears to be a later modification attempting to emphasize inclusivity but deviating from the Sanskrit source.
སྐྱབས་སུ་མཆིས] N,Q; སྐྱབས་སུ་མཆི D. The reading མཆིས is supported by the Sanskrit source गच्छामि and KP's commentary མཆིས་ཀྱི་བར་དུ་སངས་རྒྱས་...སྐྱབས་སུ་མཆིའོ

ཡི་རངས་] C,N,Q ཡི་རང་; F,G ཡི་རངས་. The reading ཡི་རངས་ is preferred based on the Sanskrit anumoditaṃ and the commentary of KP which uses ཡི་རང་བ. The spelling with final ས་ better reflects classical Tibetan orthography and matches the commentary usage.

གང་ལགས་དང་] C པ། The reading དང་ is supported by the Sanskrit source (kṛtaḥ) which shows a past participle requiring དང་ as a conjunction. Also supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which read དང་. The variant པ in C appears to be a scribal error.
དུ་མས་] N,Q དུ་མའི་ ། Sanskrit अनेकदोष and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support དུ་མས་. KP explicitly reads དུ་མས་ and GDR has དུ་མའི་ in a similar construction.
critical_apparatus.2: བཤགས་] N,Q འཆགས་ । Sanskrit देशयामि supports བཤགས་. While TS reads འཆགས་, the other commentaries (KP,GDR,KS) use བཤགས་. The reading བཤགས་ is more common in confession contexts and matches the Sanskrit deśayāmi.

critical_apparatus.1: ཆ་] N,Q ཆས། Sanskrit गन्तव्यम् and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support ཆ། KP: ཆ་ཞེས་འགྲོ་, GDR: ཆ་དགོས་, KS: ཆ་བགོས་, TS: ཆ་དགོས་

critical_apparatus.3: མ་ཤེས་པས་] C,N,Q མ་ཤེས་ནས། Sanskrit न ज्ञातम् and commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS all use མ་ཤེས་པས་) support པས་
critical_apparatus.4: མཛའི་] F,G,N,Q མཛའ། Sanskrit प्रिय and commentaries support མཛའི་

GDR's reading of ལ་ཡང་ appears to be an expansion for clarity rather than reflecting a different base text.

གློ་] N,Q བློ་ The reading གློ་ is confirmed by both the Sanskrit āgantu and all major commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). KP specifically glosses this as གློ་བུར་བ (āgantuka) meaning 'temporary' or 'guest-like'. The variant བློ་ appears to be a scribal error.

ཡོང་] «P» ཡོད་། The reading ཡོང་ is supported by the Sanskrit aviśrāmam (without rest/pause) and the commentary of KP which uses ཡོང་ཡེ་མེད་པར་ to emphasize complete absence of pause. Additionally, all other witnesses support ཡོང་།
critical_apparatus.2: གུད་] «F,G» གུས་། The reading གུད་ is confirmed by the Sanskrit āgama (coming/arrival) and consistently used in the commentaries (KP: གུད་ནས་, GDR: གུད་ནས་). གུད་ meaning 'from elsewhere/another direction' better fits the context of the verse discussing the impossibility of lifespan being supplemented from another source.

critical_apparatus.1: བསྐོར་ཀྱང་] N,Q བསྐོར་ཡང་། The reading ཀྱང་ is supported by the Sanskrit api and commentary KP's usage of ཀྱང་. Additionally, this reading better maintains the metrical structure.
critical_apparatus.2: མྱོང་བར་] F,G མྱོང་པར་། The reading བར་ is supported by the Sanskrit future passive participle सोढव्या and matches all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which consistently use བར་.

critical_apparatus.2: འཚོལ་] F,G ཚོལ་ ། Sanskrit अन्वेषी and commentary evidence (KP,TS: འཚོལ་) support འཚོལ་. The present tense form འཚོལ་ better corresponds to Sanskrit verbal form.

critical_apparatus.2: སེལ་] F,G བསེལ་ ། Sanskrit नाशनम् supports སེལ་, also confirmed by commentaries (KP: སེལ་བ, GDR: སེལ་བ, KS: སེལ་བ, TS: སེལ་བ)

critical_apparatus.1: རྣམ་སྐྲག་པས་] C,N,Q རྣམ་སྐྲག་ནས། Sanskrit भयविह्वलः and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support ནས་, indicating a temporal/causal relationship. པས་ appears to be a scribal error.

critical_apparatus.3: འཇམ་པའི་] N,Q འཇམ་དཔལ་། Sanskrit मञ्जुघोष supports འཇམ་པའི་དབྱངས་ as the standard translation.
critical_apparatus.4: ལའང་] C,N,Q ལ་ལའང་། The Sanskrit पुनश्च ('moreover/again') supports ལའང་ as the better reading, avoiding redundancy.

critical_apparatus.1: ཐུགས་རྗེས་] «C» ཐུགས་རྗེའི་ ། Both readings are grammatically possible, but ཐུགས་རྗེས་ better matches the Sanskrit instrumental कृपा (kṛpā) and is supported by KS's gloss ཐུགས་རྗེའི་ཤུགས་ལས་.
critical_apparatus.2: བསྐྱབ་] «N,Q» སྐྱབ་ ། བསྐྱབ་ is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit passive construction रक्षतु (rakṣatu) and is supported by commentaries KP and GDR which consistently use the honorific form.

critical_apparatus.1: སྐྱབས་འཚོལ་] C སྐྱབས་འཚོལ་; The reading འཚོལ་ is supported by the Sanskrit त्राणान्वेषी (seeking refuge) and consistently used by the commentators KS and TS. GDR also uses འཚོལ་ in his explanation སྐྱབས་སུ་ཚོལ་. This represents the present tense form which matches the Sanskrit present participle अन्वेषी.
མཐོང་ནས་] N,Q ན། The reading མཐོང་ནས་ is supported by the Sanskrit दृष्ट्वैव and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS). KP specifically glosses མཐོང་བ་ཙམ་ཉིད་ནས་.
critical_apparatus.2: འབྱེར་བྱེད་] N,Q མཛད། The reading བྱེད་ is supported by the Sanskrit पलायन्ते and the commentaries. KP and TS both use བྱེད་པ་, while KS has བྱེད་པར་. The variant མཛད་ appears to be an honorific form that doesn't match the Sanskrit active voice.

critical_apparatus.1: ཆེ་] C ཆེར། The reading ཆེ is preferred as it better corresponds to the Sanskrit bhaya (भय) which appears without intensifiers. While C's ཆེར ('greatly') is supported by KP's commentary (ཆེར་ཏེ་ཆེན་པོ), the simpler reading ཆེ aligns with both the Sanskrit source and the majority of witnesses. Additionally, other commentators (GDR, KS, TS) use ཆེ or ཆེན་པོ without the intensifying -ར suffix.

ཉེས་པ་བརྒྱའི] C ཉེས་བརྒྱ་ཡི། The reading ཉེས་པ་བརྒྱའི is preferred based on the Sanskrit व्याधिशतैर् which explicitly includes both terms (व्याधि corresponding to ནད/ཉེས་པ and शत corresponding to བརྒྱ). This is further supported by the commentaries: KS has ཉེས་པ་བརྒྱ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ, and GDR mentions ཉེས་པ་བརྒྱ་སྟོང་ཕྲག. The compound construction in the main reading better reflects the Sanskrit compound.

བརླག་] N,Q རླག་ | The reading བརླག་ is supported by the Sanskrit नश्यन्ति and multiple commentaries: KP བརླག་པར་བྱེད་, KS རླག་པར་བྱེད་. The བ- prefix is etymologically correct and matches the Sanskrit causative form.
critical_apparatus.2: བྱེད་ལ་] C བྱེད་ན་ | Reading བྱེད་ན་ is adopted following C, supported by Sanskrit यतः and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). The particle ན་better conveys the conditional meaning present in the Sanskrit verse.

critical_apparatus.1: ད་གཡང་ས་] C,F,G,P ད་གཡང་; D སྨད་པའི་གནས་ད་གཡང་; I ད་ཡང་. Reading ད་གཡང་ས་ based on majority of witnesses and support from commentaries. KS, GDR, and KP all use གཡང་ས་. Sanskrit प्रपात also supports this reading.
critical_apparatus.2: ཆུང་ངུ་] I ཆུང་ངུ་དུ་. Reading ཆུང་ངུ་ supported by majority of witnesses and commentaries. KP specifically references ཆུང་ངུ་, and Sanskrit इतर ('ordinary, small') also supports this reading.

critical_apparatus.1: དེ་] I དི་ ༡ Sanskrit अद्य and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) support དེ་. KP explicitly glosses དུས་དེ་རིང་.
critical_apparatus.2: འབྱུང་] C འགྱུར་ ༢ Reading འབྱུང་ is supported by Sanskrit एति and most commentaries. Only KP reads འགྱུར་, while GDR, KS, and TS all attest འབྱུང་. The Sanskrit present tense एति favors འབྱུང་.

critical_apparatus.1: བདག་] F,G འདག་ | The reading བདག་ is confirmed by Skt. me and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS)
critical_apparatus.2: ཡིས་] N,Q ཡི་ | ཡིས་ better corresponds to Skt. instrumental केन and is supported by KP
critical_apparatus.3: ཞེས་] C འགྱུར་ | ཞེས་ is preferred as it better fits the verse structure and is supported by commentarial explanations
critical_apparatus.4: ཇི་ལྟར་] C ཅི་ལྟར་, N,Q ཅི་ཕྱིར་ | ཇི་ལྟར་ corresponds to Skt. kasmāt and is supported by KP's gloss ཇི་ལྟར་

critical_apparatus.1: མངོན་] N,Q སྔོན་ | མངོན་ is supported by the Sanskrit अभि (in अभिनिविष्टेन) and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which consistently interpret this as མངོན་པར་ཞེན་ (manifest attachment), matching the Sanskrit compound अभिनिविष्टेन (intensely attached).
རྣམས་] C རྣམ་; རྣམས་ chosen based on Sanskrit परिचितान् (plural form) and supported by commentaries KP, GDR, KS, and TS which all use རྣམས་

ཐོ་བའམ་] C,N,Q ཐོའམ། The reading ཐོ་བའམ is adopted based on multiple factors: 1) It corresponds more precisely to Sanskrit सावद्य (sāvadya); 2) All commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) use the full form ཐོ་བ; 3) KP explicitly glosses ཁ་ན་མ་ཐོ་བ as ཁ་ཐོག་ཏུ་ཕུད་མི་ཕོད་པ; 4) The contracted form ཐོའམ appears to be a scribal abbreviation.
སྡིག] F,G སྡིག་
critical_apparatus.2: གཟུང] F,G བཟུང། The reading གཟུང is supported by Sanskrit प्रतिगृह्णन्तु and KP's gloss གཟུང་དུ་གསོལ་བའམ་ཞུ་བ

critical_apparatus.1: གི། །] C གི། ། The double shad after གི in C is redundant as it breaks the metrical structure. The single shad is supported by the Sanskrit verse structure and followed by all other witnesses.
critical_apparatus.2: ངལ་སོའི་] C བསོའི་ The reading ངལ་སོའི་ is preferred as it better corresponds to Sanskrit विश्रामं (viśrāmaṃ). This is further supported by KP's gloss ངལ་བསོ and KS's explanation ངལ་གསོ་བའི་, indicating that the base form should be ངལ་སོ་.

critical_apparatus.1: ཕན་པ་] C,N,Q ཕན་པར། The lemma ཕན་པ་ is supported by the Sanskrit source सत्त्वहिताधान and the commentaries. KP explicitly glosses as ཕན་པ་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ. While C,N,Q read ཕན་པར་, the terminative case is not reflected in Sanskrit and is unnecessary for the meaning. The non-terminative form better matches both Sanskrit syntax and Tibetan commentarial interpretations.

སྒྲོན་མེ་སྦར་] C སྒྲོན་མ་སྦར་; N,Q སྒྲོན་མེ་སྤར་. The reading མེ་སྦར་ is supported by the Sanskrit प्रदीपं and the commentaries: KP has མེ་...སྦར་, GDR has མེ་སྦར་, and TS uses མེ་སྦར་. Additionally, སྦར་ ('to light/kindle') is the more appropriate verb for སྒྲོན་མེ་ ('lamp') than སྤར་ ('to raise/elevate').

མི་དགོད་] C འགོད་ ॥ The reading མི་དགོད་ is supported by the Sanskrit negative construction मा भूत् and by GDR's commentary which glosses this as མི་དགོད་ཅིང་སྟེ་མ་རིག་པའི་མུན་པ་བསལ་བའི་ཆེད་དུ. Additionally, KP's commentary clarifies the meaning as མི་འགོད་ཅིང་, confirming the negative construction. The variant འགོད་ in C appears to be a scribal error that disrupts both the meaning and the grammatical parallel with the Sanskrit.

སྡུག་བསྔལ་] C,N,Q གནོད་པ། The reading སྡུག་བསྔལ་ is preferred as it directly corresponds to the Sanskrit व्यथां (vyathām). Additionally, KS's commentary uses གནོད་པ་ but in a different context, while most other commentators discuss the general concept of suffering (སྡུག་བསྔལ་). The Sanskrit compound क्षुत्पिपासाव्यथां supports this reading as it refers specifically to the 'suffering/pain of hunger and thirst' rather than mere 'harm.'

མདུན་དུ་] C མདུན་ན། The reading མདུན་དུ་ is supported by the Sanskrit agratas (མདུན་དུ་). While C reads མདུན་ན, the locative form ན is less precise in conveying the directional sense found in the Sanskrit. Additionally, KP's commentary uses མདུན་ན, while GDR uses མདུན་ན, KS uses མདུན་ན, and TS uses མདུན་ན. Despite the commentarial tradition favoring ན, we follow the Sanskrit agratas which is better rendered by དུ.
སྒྲུབ་] C བསྒྲུབ་ | The reading སྒྲུབ་ is supported by the Sanskrit arthasiddhaye and KS's བསྒྲུབ་པ་.
critical_apparatus.2: ཕངས་པ་] C ཕོངས་པ་, I ཕོངས་བ་ | ཕངས་པ་ is supported by Sanskrit nirapekṣa and KP's commentary which uses ཕངས་པ་ in the sense of 'being reluctant to give'. The variants ཕོངས་པ་/ཕོངས་བ་ ('poverty/destitute') do not fit the context.

critical_apparatus.1: བཏང་] F,G གཏང་ | Skt. त्याग supports བཏང་. Also confirmed by KP's commentary བཏང་བས་
critical_apparatus.2: སྒྲུབ་] C,N,Q བསྒྲུབ་ | The simple form སྒྲུབ་ agrees with Skt. अर्थि (desire/seek) and is supported by GDR's reading སྒྲུབ་འདོད་
critical_apparatus.3: བཏང་བ་] N གཏད་པ་ Q གཏང་བ་ | བཏང་བ་ is supported by Skt. दीयताम् (let it be given) and matches KP's commentary བཏང་བ་མཆོག་

critical_apparatus.1: སྨོད་] F,G སྨོན་ ། སྨོད་ is supported by Skt. निन्दन्तु ('may they revile') and all commentaries: GDR: ཚིག་གིས་སྨོད་པ, KP: ངག་གིས་སྨོད་པ, KS: སྨོད་པ, TS: ཚིག་གིས་སྨོད་པ
བདག་གི་] N བདག་གིས་ ། The reading བདག་གི་ is confirmed by Skt. mama and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS).
critical_apparatus.2: རྩེ་བྱེད་] The reading is supported by Skt. क्रीडन्तु (krīḍantu) and commentaries: KP རྩེ་འཇོ་, GDR རྩེད་མོས་རྩེ་བར་, TS རྩེད་མོ་རྩེ་བར་
critical_apparatus.3: ག་ཞའི་] This reading corresponds to Skt. विलसन्तु (vilasantu) and is glossed by KP as གཞད་གད་, by GDR as བཞད་གད་, and by KS as བཞད་གད་

critical_apparatus.1: ཡིན་པའང་] N,Q ཡིན་པ། Reading པའང་ is supported by Sanskrit कारयन्तु and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which treat this as a continuous clause. The particle འང་ is required to convey the inclusive sense present in the Sanskrit.

ཁྲོའམ་] C གིས། །ཁྲོའམ་; F,G གི །ཁྲོའམ་; N,Q གིས། ཁྲོ་འམ་; C,N,Q ཁྲོ་བའམ་. The reading ཁྲོའམ་ is supported by the Sanskrit क्रुद्ध and commentaries of KS and TS which use ཁོང་ཁྲོ་བ and ཁྲོ་བ respectively.
critical_apparatus.2: བྱུང་ན་] C,N,Q བྱུང་བན་. The reading བྱུང་ན་is supported by the Sanskrit भवेत् and all commentaries which consistently use ན་as the conditional particle.
critical_apparatus.3: དེ་དག་གི། །] C དག་གི། །. The reading དེ་དག་གི། is supported by the Sanskrit तेषां and commentaries of GDR and KS which explicitly mention དེ་དག་གི་.

critical_apparatus.1: གང་] N,Q གང་; All other witnesses omit གང་. The omission is supported by the Sanskrit न्येऽपि and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which do not include an equivalent term. The variant in N,Q appears to be a scribal addition.
རྣམས་ཀྱི་] N,Q རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ ། Sanskrit अनाथानाम् supports the genitive case. All commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) consistently use the genitive case ཀྱི།
critical_apparatus.2: བརྒལ་] N རྒལ་ ། The spelling བརྒལ་ is supported by the Sanskrit पारेप्सूनां (those desiring to cross over) and consistently used in the commentaries (KP: བརྒལ་, GDR: བརྒལ་, KS: བརྒལ་, TS: བརྒལ་).

critical_apparatus.1: གྱུར་པར་] C,N,Q འགྱུར་བར་. The reading འགྱུར་བར་ is supported by the Sanskrit optative form भवेयम् and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). KP explicitly glosses འགྱུར་བར་ in his commentary. The Sanskrit optative mood is better rendered by འགྱུར་བར་ than གྱུར་པར་.

ནོར་དང་བུ་] N,Q ནོར་དང་བུ། The reading 'ནོར་དང་' is confirmed by the Sanskrit 'चिन्तामणि' and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which gloss it as 'ཡིད་བཞིན་གྱི་ནོར་བུ'. The variant reading with 'བུ' in N,Q appears to be a scribal error.

གཞིར་] D བཞིར་ ། The reading གཞིར་ is supported by all other witnesses and commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). This is also confirmed by the Sanskrit source where the term corresponds to भोग (enjoyment/resources), making གཞིར་ (basis/foundation) the more appropriate reading. KP specifically glosses this as རྒྱུའམ་གཞིར་. The variant བཞིར་ in D appears to be a scribal error possibly influenced by the frequent mention of the four elements (བཞི) earlier in the verse.
ཀུན་ཏུ། །] C,F,G ཏུ། །; I དུ། །. The reading ཀུན་ཏུ། is supported by Skt. अनेकधा and the commentaries of KP (རྣམ་པ་ཀུན་ཏུ) and GDR (རྣམ་པ་ཀུན་ཏུ).
critical_apparatus.2: ཉེར་] N,Q ཉེ་. The reading ཉེར་ is supported by Skt. उपजीव्य and the commentaries of KP (ཉེར་འཚོ) and GDR (ཉེར་འཚོ). The spelling ཉེར་ better reflects the classical Tibetan orthography for this term.

critical_apparatus.1: ཕྱིར] «Q» ཕྱིར་རོ། Sanskrit पुष्ट्यर्थं and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) support the simpler reading without རོ.
critical_apparatus.2: གཟེངས་] «N,Q» གཟེང་། Sanskrit प्रहर्षयेत् and unanimous commentarial tradition support གཟེངས་. The form གཟེང་ appears to be an orthographic variant.

critical_apparatus.1: དེང་དུས་] «C» དུ། Sanskrit अद्य and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) support དེང་དུས་
critical_apparatus.2: དེ་] «I» དི། Sanskrit अद्य and all commentaries support དེ་
critical_apparatus.3: བདག་དེང་གྱུར་] «C» ད་གྱུར་ཏོ། The reading བདག་དེང་གྱུར་ better corresponds to Sanskrit सांप्रतम् (at present) and अस्मि (I am). While GDR, KS and TS read ད་གྱུར་, the presence of बुद्धपुत्रोऽस्मि in Sanskrit supports retaining བདག་

critical_apparatus.1: ཕྱག་དར་] I ཕྱག་དར་དང་། The reading without དང་ is supported by the Sanskrit संकारकूटेभ्यो which is a compound not requiring a conjunction. Additionally, all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) read ཕྱག་དར་ without དང་.

བདུད་རྩི་] N,Q བདུད་རྩིའི། The reading བདུད་རྩི་ is supported by the Sanskrit rasāyanam and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). The variant with འི་ in N,Q appears to be a scribal error that disrupts both meaning and meter.
འཁྱམས་ཞིང་] «N,Q» : འཁྱམ་ཞིང་ «Main» : འཁྱམས་ཤིང་ «C» ། Sanskrit भ्रमण supports འཁྱམས་. All commentaries (KS,TS) also read འཁྱམས་.
critical_apparatus.2: ངལ་གསོའི་] «F,G» : ངལ་སོ་ «Main» : ངལ་བསོའི་ «C» ། Reading གསོའི་ supported by Sanskrit विश्राम and majority of commentaries (KS,TS). Also provides better grammatical construction.

critical_apparatus.1: མི་] «I» མེ། The reading མི་ is confirmed by all other witnesses and the Sanskrit ajñāna. Additionally, KP, KS, and TS all gloss this as མི་ཤེས་པ་, confirming མི་ as the correct reading.
critical_apparatus.2: བསྲུབས་] «Q» བསྲུབ། The reading བསྲུབས་ is supported by the Sanskrit मथन (mathana) and the commentaries, particularly KP's བསྲུབས་པ་ and GDR's བསྲུབས་པ་.
critical_apparatus.3: ལས་] «Q» ལ། The ablative ལས་ is confirmed by the Sanskrit ablative -āt and supported by all commentaries.
critical_apparatus.4: བྱུང་] «C» ཕྱུང། While both readings are semantically possible, བྱུང་ better corresponds to the Sanskrit समुत्थितम् (samutthitam). However, some commentaries (KP, GDR, TS) use ཕྱུང་in their explanations.

critical_apparatus.1: མགྲོན་པོ་] C འགྲོན་པོ་; N,Q འགྲོན་པ། The reading མགྲོན་པོ་ is supported by KS's commentary which uses མགྲོན་པོ་. The Sanskrit जनसार्थ ('group of people, caravan') can be rendered either way, but མགྲོན་པོ་ better reflects the metaphor of 'guests' that runs through the verse.
critical_apparatus.2: མགྲོན་] C,N,Q འགྲོན་. Selected མགྲོན་ for consistency with the first occurrence in line 1, supported by KS's use of མགྲོན་. The Sanskrit आगत in compound अभ्यागत supports this reading as it specifically refers to 'guests' or 'visitors'.

critical_apparatus.1: དེ་] F,G,I དི་ । The reading དེ་ is supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) and matches the Sanskrit अद्य । The variant དི་ appears to be a scribal error.
བཟུང་] C,F,G,N,Q གཟུང་། KS, KP བཟུང་། Sanskrit परिग्रह supports བཟུང་, which is also the lectio difficilior. གཟུང་ appears to be a later standardization.

དམ་བཅས་] F,G དམ་བཅའ། Sanskrit प्रतिज्ञाय supports དམ་བཅས་. All commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) use དམ་བཅའ་ or དམ་བཅས་ interchangeably, confirming either reading is acceptable. The past tense form དམ་བཅས་ better matches the context.
critical_apparatus.2: བྱའམ་བཏང་] Q བྱའམ་གཏང་། Sanskrit कुर्यान्न supports བྱའམ་བཏང་. KP's commentary explicitly uses བཏུང་ while other commentaries (GDR,KS,TS) use བཏང་, supporting the chosen reading.

critical_apparatus.1: བརྟག་བརྟགས་] «C» བརྟགས་། The reading བརྟགས་བརྟགས་ is supported by the Sanskrit intensive construction यथाशक्ति ('according to ability') and corroborated by all commentaries. critical_apparatus.1: ནི] C,N,Q ན། The reading ནི is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit construction बालानां स्वभावो where ནི functions as a topic marker, corresponding to the genitive in Sanskrit. This is supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which use ཡིན་ན/ཡིན་ནམ constructions indicating ནི as the original reading.
critical_apparatus.2: ཁྲོ་བ] C,N,Q ཁྲོ་བར། The form without the terminative -ར is chosen as it better reflects the Sanskrit कोपः (nominative singular) and aligns with the verse's metric requirements. The commentaries show variation, with some using བར (KP) and others using བ (KS, TS), but the simpler form བ better matches both the Sanskrit and the meter.

critical_apparatus.1: སྐྱོན་དེ་] C སྐྱོན་འདི། Sanskrit अयम् and commentaries KP, GDR, KS, TS support reading འདི།
critical_apparatus.2: དེས་པ་ནའང་] F,G ངེས་པ་ནའང་; N,Q དེས་པས་ན། Sanskrit प्रकृतिपेशलाः and KP's gloss འཇམ་པོ་ support དེས་པ།
critical_apparatus.3: ཁྲོ་བ་] C,F,G,N,Q ཁྲོ་བར། Sanskrit कोपः supports noun form ཁྲོ་བ།

critical_apparatus.1: རྦད་] C,F,G རྦད་; I སྤད་. The reading རྦད་ is confirmed by both the Sanskrit (प्रेरितः) and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS uniformly use རྦད་). The variant སྤད་ in I appears to be a scribal error.
critical_apparatus.2: ཉིས་] C,N,Q ཉིས་; others ཉེས་. The reading ཉིས་ is supported by GDR's gloss ཉིས་ན་སྟེ་གཉིས་སུའམ་ and KS's gloss གཉིས་སུ་ན, indicating it means 'secondly/alternatively'. This better fits the context of the verse presenting two options for directing anger.

critical_apparatus.1: གཉིས་ཀའང་] C གཉི་ག N,Q གཉིས་ཀ། The reading གཉིས་ཀའང་ is supported by KP's commentary གཉིས་ཀའང་ and corresponds better to Sanskrit द्वयं. The emphatic འང་ particle reinforces the dual nature emphasized in the verse.
critical_apparatus.2: བདག་གི] C བདག་གིས། The genitive གི is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit मम and is supported by all other witnesses and commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS all use གི).

critical_apparatus.1: སྲེད་མདོངས་] C,N,Q སྲེད་ལྡོངས། Sanskrit: तृष्णान्धेन supports ལྡོངས་ (blind). All commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support ལྡོངས་, with KP glossing it as ལོང་བ་ (blind), GDR as མདོངས་པ་ (blind), and both KS and TS using ལྡོངས་པ་ directly.
critical_apparatus.2: གནོད་པ་] F,G གནོད་པས་། Sanskrit: व्यथायां supports instrumental case. However, all commentaries use གནོད་པ་. The locative/objective form better fits the verse's meaning of 'whom to be angry at regarding the harm.'

critical_apparatus.1: གནོད་གྱུར་པ] N,Q པས; C,D པ། The reading པས is preferred based on Sanskrit स्वापराधागते where the instrumental case is used. This is also supported by KP's commentary which uses པས་ན.
critical_apparatus.2: བཀོན་དུ] C ཏུ། The reading དུ is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit construction कस्मात् ... कुप्यते and is supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which consistently use དུ.

critical_apparatus.1: བསྐྱེད་པན] C,N,Q བསྐྱེད་པ; I བསྐྱེད་བ། The reading བསྐྱེད་པན is preferred as it corresponds to Sanskrit जनिता and is supported by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) who read བསྐྱེད་པ. The variant བསྐྱེད་བ in I appears to be a scribal error.
ལས་ཀྱིས་] N,Q ལས་ཀྱི། Sanskrit मत्कर्म supports instrumental case. All commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) use instrumental ཀྱིས་.
critical_apparatus.2: དེས་ནི་] N,Q དེས། Sanskrit येन supports the inclusion of ནི་ as emphatic particle.
critical_apparatus.3: དམྱལ་འདོང་] C,F,G དམྱལ་དོང་། D དམྱལ་འདོང་། Sanskrit नरकान् यास्यन्ति and commentary evidence (KP,GDR: དམྱལ་བར་འདོང་/འདོར་) support འདོང་ as the correct future form of 'to go'.
critical_apparatus.4: བརླག་] D བརླགས་། Sanskrit हता and commentary evidence (KP,GDR,KS,TS all use བརླག་) support the simple form བརླག་.

critical_apparatus.1: རྟེན་] N,Q བརྟེན་ ། Sanskrit आश्रित्य and all commentaries support རྟེན་. KS, GDR, and TS all read རྟེན་.
critical_apparatus.2: འབྱུང་] C,F,G,I འབྱང་ ། Sanskrit क्षीयते supports འབྱུང་. While KP and TS read འབྱང་, both GDR and KS support འབྱུང་. The Sanskrit क्षीयते ('to be destroyed/exhausted') is better rendered by འབྱུང་ ('to emerge/be eliminated') than འབྱང་ ('to be purified').

critical_apparatus.1: འགྲོ། ] F,G འགྲོ །། The single shad reading is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit verse structure and is supported by most witnesses. The double shad in F,G appears to be a scribal innovation.
critical_apparatus.2: བྱུང་ ] N,Q འབྱུང་། The reading བྱུང་ is preferred as it better corresponds to Sanskrit आयातं (āyātaṃ, 'occurred/happened' in past tense). This is further supported by KP's gloss བྱུང་སྟེ། Additionally, the temporal context in all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) consistently treats this as a past event.

critical_apparatus.1: ལུས་ནི་] N,Q ལུས་ནི་འདི་ ། The reading without འདི་ is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit source (śarīra) which has no demonstrative pronoun. All commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) also consistently use ལུས་ནི་ without འདི་.

ཅིའི་] C ཅི་ | Reading ཅིའི་ is supported by the Sanskrit source कस्मात् (kasmāt) which is in the ablative case requiring the genitive ཅིའི་ in Tibetan. This is also confirmed by commentaries KP and GDR who both use ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་. The reading ཅི་ in C appears to be a scribal simplification.
བདག་གི་] C བདག་གིས་ - The reading གི་ is preferred as it matches the Sanskrit genitive construction मे लाभः (me lābhaḥ) and is supported by most witnesses.
critical_apparatus.2: འདིར་] N,Q འདི་ - The reading འདིར་ is adopted as it better corresponds to the Sanskrit locative इह (iha) and is supported by KP's commentary which glosses འཇིག་རྟེན་འདིར་

critical_apparatus.1: ལོག་འཚོས་] N,Q འཚོ། 'ལོག་འཚོས་' is supported by Skt. मिथ्याजीवितं and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which interpret it as wrong livelihood (ལོག་འཚོ་). KP specifically elaborates on types of wrong livelihood including flattery (ཁ་གསགས་), hypocrisy (ཚུལ་འཆོས་), etc.
གཉི་ག་] C གཉིས་ཀ་ | The reading གཉིས་ཀ་ is supported by Sanskrit द्वयोः and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS use གཉིས་ཀ་). The variant གཉི་ག་ appears to be a dialect form.
critical_apparatus.2: གཉི་ག་] C གཉིས་ཀ་ | As in note 1, གཉིས་ཀ་ is the standard form supported by commentaries and Sanskrit.
critical_apparatus.3: དུས་སུ་] C,N,Q དུས་ན་ | Both readings are grammatically correct. དུས་ན་ is supported by KP's commentary and matches Sanskrit काले. The majority of witnesses support དུས་ན་.

critical_apparatus.1: བདེ་སྤྱད་ཀྱང་] I བདེ་སྤྱད་ཀྱང། The Sanskrit भुक्त्वा सुखान्यपि and all commentaries (KP: བདེ་བ་...སྤྱད་ཀྱང་, GDR: བདེ་བ་སྤྱད་ཀྱང་, KS: བདེ་བ་ལ་སྤྱད་ཀྱང་) support this reading.
critical_apparatus.2: སྟོང་པར་འགྲོ།] F,G སྟོང་པར་འགྲོ །  The single shad after འགྲོ is preferred as it marks the end of the verse. This is supported by the Sanskrit verse ending and commentary tradition (KP: འགྲོ་དགོས་སོ།, GDR: འགྲོ་དགོས་སོ།)

critical_apparatus.1: ཉམས་བྱེད་པས་] F,G ཉམས་འགྱུར་ན། The reading བྱེད་པས་is preferred based on multiple factors: 1) It better corresponds to the Sanskrit नाशयति (causative form of √naś), where བྱེད་པས་reflects the causative sense. 2) All commentaries support this reading - KP explicitly uses བྱེད་པས་, KS uses བྱེད་པ་, and both GDR and TS discuss the causative sense of 'causing deterioration' (ཉམས་པར་བྱེད་). 3) The variant འགྱུར་ན་would suggest a non-causative state of deterioration, which doesn't match the argumentative context established in the commentaries.
སྐྱེས་] C,F,G སྐྱེ། Sanskrit क्लेशात्पाद supports སྐྱེས་, referring to arisen afflictions. KP's commentary also uses སྐྱེས་.
critical_apparatus.2: པས་] N,Q པའི། Sanskrit परायत्त and commentaries support པས་. Both GDR and KS use རག་ལས་པས་ construction.

critical_apparatus.1: ཚུལ་གྱིས་] C གྱི་ ། The reading གྱིས་ is confirmed by the Sanskrit instrumental form -vat in pūrva-vat and supported by all commentaries. KP, GDR, and TS explicitly gloss this as an instrumental case (གྱིས་). The variant གྱི་ in C appears to be a scribal error.
གཉིས་ཀས་] C,N,Q གཉི་གས་; གཉིས་ཀས་ chosen based on Sanskrit द्वय (dva-ya) and supported by all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS)
critical_apparatus.2: བྱས་] N,Q བྱེད་; བྱས་ confirmed by Sanskrit कृता (kṛtā) and commentaries (KP: བྱས་པར་འགྱུར་, GDR: བྱས་པར་)

critical_apparatus.1: སྐྱོན་དང་བཅས་ཏེ་] C སྐྱོན་དང་བཅས་དེ། The reading སྐྱོན་དང་བཅས་ཏེ་ is supported by the Sanskrit apara ̄dhinam and all major commentaries (KP, GDR, KS). Additionally, the instrumental particle ཏེ་ better conveys the sense of the Sanskrit accusative construction. The variant དེ་ in C appears to be a scribal error.

ཅི་] I ཅེ། The reading ཅི་ is supported by all other witnesses and the commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS). It also better corresponds to the Sanskrit construction तु...येन. Additionally, ཅི་ནས་ཀྱང་ is a standard construction meaning 'by all means' that appears frequently in Buddhist literature.
མེ] «C» མེ་ཚེ། Sanskrit दह्यमाने supports the reading མེ, confirmed by all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS)
critical_apparatus.2: དོར་བ་ཡིན] «C» འདོར་བར་རིགས «F,G» དོར་བ་རིགས། The reading དོར་བ་ཡིན is supported by Sanskrit अपनीयते (passive form of √नी with prefix अप्). While commentaries use རིགས, the base text's ཡིན better matches the Sanskrit passive construction

critical_apparatus.1: ཆགས་ན] C,N,Q ཆགས་ནས། The reading ནས is supported by Sanskrit आसङ्गात् (ablative) and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) which consistently interpret this as ཆགས་ནས.
critical_apparatus.2: ཚིག] C འཚིག། The reading ཚིག is supported by Sanskrit उद्दाह and commentary KP which uses འཚིག, showing both variants preserve the same meaning. ཚིག is preferred as the more common classical spelling.

critical_apparatus.1: བསད་པའི་] N,Q; གསད་བྱའི་ I. The reading བསད་པའི་ is supported by the Sanskrit मारणीय (māraṇīya) and multiple commentaries: KP has བསད་བྱའི་, GDR has གསོད་པར་འོས་པའི་, and KS has གསོད་པར་བྱ་བའི་. While I has གསད་བྱའི་, the unanimous support from the Sanskrit and commentarial tradition favors བསད་པའི་ as the correct reading.
བསྲེག་] C,N,Q སྲེག་ ། Sanskrit कारितोऽस्मि and commentary KP བསྲེག་ support the causative form བསྲེག་
critical_apparatus.2: མྱོང་] N,Q མྱོས་ ། Sanskrit सहस्रशः and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support མྱོང་
critical_apparatus.3: ཀྱང་] C,F,G ཡང་ ། Both variants are grammatically possible, but ཀྱང་ is supported by GDR's commentary ཀྱང་ and better matches the Sanskrit एव

critical_apparatus.1: གནོད་མིན་] N མིག་མིན། གནོད་མིན་ is supported by Skt. दुःखं and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which gloss it as གནོད་པ་ཆེན་པོ་མིན།
critical_apparatus.2: འགྱུར་བས་] F,G འགྱུར་པས། འགྱུར་བས་ is supported by Skt. करिष्यति and KP's gloss འགྱུར་བས།

critical_apparatus.1: གཞན་གྱིས་] N,Q གཞན་གྱི། Skt. anyaiḥ and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support instrumental case གཞན་གྱིས་
critical_apparatus.2: ཅིའི་] C ཅི། Skt. kasmād and commentaries (KP,GDR,TS) support genitive form ཅིའི་

critical_apparatus.1: ཁ་ན་མ་ཐོ་] F,G ཁ་ན་མ་ཐོབ། The reading ཐོ་ is confirmed by Sanskrit निरवद्य (meaning 'blameless') and supported by all commentaries. KP explicitly glosses as ཁ་ན་མ་ཐོ་བ་སྡིག་པ་མེད་པ་. GDR, KS, and TS all use ཁ་ན་མ་ཐོ་བ་ in their explanations.

གླ་རྔན་] N,Q གླ་ངན་. The reading རྔན་ is supported by the Sanskrit bhṛti and all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) which consistently interpret this as wages/payment (གླ་རྔན་). KP explicitly glosses this as བྲན་གཡོག་ལ་གླ་རྔན་སྦྱིན་པ་ ('giving wages to servants'), matching the context.
ལ་] N,Q ལའང་། Sanskrit परसौख्यम् and all commentaries (KP,GDR,KS,TS) support the simple ལ་. The variant ལའང་ is likely a later addition attempting to parallel the འང་ in བདེ་བའང་.
critical_apparatus.2: བདེ་བའང་] N,Q བདེ་བ། The reading བདེ་བའང་ is supported by Sanskrit अपि and commentaries (KP: བདེ་བའང་, TS: བདེ་བ་འདོད་). The emphatic particle འང་ corresponds to Sanskrit अपि.

critical_apparatus.1: དེས་] N,Q ནས། ད་ The reading དེས་ is supported by the Sanskrit demonstrative तस्य (tasya) implicit in the compound कस्मात् (kasmāt). Additionally, all commentaries (KP, GDR, KS, TS) consistently use དེས་ in their explanations.
